intro: Planchonella xerocarpa, commonly known as the dry-fruited pandanus, is a tropical plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces woody, dry fruits that are typically dispersed by wind.
